text: The Pillow Book is a book written by Sei Shōnagon .Women's Political & Social Thought: An Anthology, eds. Hilda L. Smith; Berenice A. Carroll (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 2000), p. 20 Sei Shōnagon was a member of the Kiyohara family. She wrote the notes that made up her diary (or "pillow book") while she was a member of the court of Empress Sadako. The book is a classic of Japanese literature. It is one of two of the greatest examples of prose literature of this time period. It is a collection of pieces of writing that vary from one or two sentences to several pages. It is the author's observations of people, life at court, and nature.Donald Keene, Seeds in the Heart: Japanese Literature from Earliest Times to the Late Sixteenth Century (New York: Columbia University Press, 1999), p. 412 == References == == Other websites == * The Pillow Book Category:Diaries Category:Japanese literature Category:10th-century works
